p: Gott’s rule assumes we have no special knowledge of our position on the epidemic curve [ 39]. Given Y 0 cases reported, assuming a non-informative uniform prior for the portion α of the epidemic observed to date, the corresponding probability density function for the final size Y = Y 0/ α is Y 0/ y 2, Y 0 ≤ y. We constructed a probability mass function by assigning all probability density to the whole number of days given by the integer part of each value. We used this probability mass function as a projection of the final outbreak size.
